problem.p: This is a concept question, provided to check your understanding of the previous lecture video clips.
Which of the following are true?

choice.text: Each syndrome corresponding to distinct correctable Pauli errors is unique.
The members of a normalizer group always commute with each other.
Suppose in a five-qubit code we correct for a wrong syndrome. It is still possible to to recover the state after the application of another correctable error.
The minimal number of elements generating a normalizer group is [mathjaxinline]n + k[/mathjaxinline] for an [mathjaxinline][[n,k,d]][/mathjaxinline] code.
